message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SD

This paper combines two strands of research in Language & Vision: zero-shot learning and pragmatic object descriptions. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-categories that cover these areas. Specifically, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely category as it covers natural language processing and generation, which are central to the paper's approach. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also likely categories as they cover the development of intelligent agents and models, which are used in the paper. cs.CV (Computer Vision) is another possible category as it covers the analysis and understanding of visual data, which is used in the paper's task of referring to objects in images. Finally, cs.SD (Sound) is a less likely category, but it covers speech processing, which is relevant to the paper's use of speech acts.
